'use strict';

const crypto = require('crypto');

const macroCheck = new RegExp('[./]macro');

module.exports = function() {
  return {

This function transforms the Babel configuration on a per-file basis

 
    config(config, { source }) {

Babel Macros are notoriously hard to cache, so they shouldn't be https://github.com/babel/babel/issues/8497 We naively detect macros using their package suffix and add a random token to the caller, a valid option accepted by Babel, to compose a one-time cacheIdentifier for the file. We cannot tune the loader options on a per file basis.

 
      if (macroCheck.test(source)) {
        return Object.assign({}, config.options, {
          caller: Object.assign({}, config.options.caller, {
            craInvalidationToken: crypto.randomBytes(32).toString('hex'),
          }),
        });
      }
      return config.options;
    },
  };
};
